posts.post_content:
Erik's Random card 6/21/2011  
This was in the design file, priced at 2B.  
  
I thought it would make Standard more fun at 1B. This block has a lot of artifact creatures. However they were at a competitive disadvantage compared with Black creatures because of Doom Blade. Pricing this card at 1B put it on par with Doom Blade, and helped put artifact creatures on par with black creatures.

posts.post_content:
Fools, only the most powerful magic can destroy Emrakul. That or [Ersatz Gnomes](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ersatz Gnomes).
  
   
Though it is very likely that Emrakul will be an illegal target as the spell is being cast, rather than when the spell resolves. So you may have to work around it by targeting an [Inktreader Nephilim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inktreader Nephilim), and then making GTFO colorless. (this ofcourse turns GTFO into a 2 cmc [Damnation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damnation))

posts.post_content:
It's like someone said...  
  
Man 1 "Hmmm... Is it just me, or is terror not that good?"  
  
Man 2 "Yeah, you're right. What if we took away the "artifact" bit?" We could call it doom blade!"  
  
Man 1 "That's a good idea! Lets do it!"  
  
Man 2 "What about the other half? The non-black part?"  
  
Man 1 "Nah, if we took that away, it'd be way to good."  
  
Man 2 leaps at him and tears out his esophagus.  
  
"I think I'll call it... Go for the throat."
posts.html:
It's like someone said...

Man 1 "Hmmm... Is it just me, or is terror not that good?"

Man 2 "Yeah, you're right. What if we took away the "artifact" bit?" We could call it doom blade!"

Man 1 "That's a good idea! Lets do it!"

Man 2 "What about the other half? The non-black part?"

Man 1 "Nah, if we took that away, it'd be way to good."

Man 2 leaps at him and tears out his esophagus.

"I think I'll call it... Go for the throat."

Posted By: Swiftgamer18 (1/27/2011 4:42:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terror) is survived by black creatures and artifacts.  
[Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) is survived by black creatures and regenerators.  
[Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat) is survived by artifacts and regenerators.  
  
The cycle is complete.  
  
Between black creatures, artifacts and regenerators, black creatures are the most common, so this is definitely the best of the three. That said, I will never want to put four of these in a deck unless I have at least two [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade)s. I'll play this over [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade), but I'll still split when I can. I'm thinking 1/0, 1/1, 2/1, 3/1, 3/2, 4/2, 4/3, 4/4 for my progression of [Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat)/[Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) from 1 to 8 copies. [Grasp of Darkness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grasp of Darkness) probably would go in there too if the deck is black enough, of course.
posts.html:
Terror is survived by black creatures and artifacts.
Doom Blade is survived by black creatures and regenerators.
Go for the Throat is survived by artifacts and regenerators.

The cycle is complete.

Between black creatures, artifacts and regenerators, black creatures are the most common, so this is definitely the best of the three. That said, I will never want to put four of these in a deck unless I have at least two Doom Blades. I'll play this over Doom Blade, but I'll still split when I can. I'm thinking 1/0, 1/1, 2/1, 3/1, 3/2, 4/2, 4/3, 4/4 for my progression of Go for the Throat/Doom Blade from 1 to 8 copies. Grasp of Darkness probably would go in there too if the deck is black enough, of course.

Posted By: hottychick88 (10/15/2012 10:54:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not going to lie, I prefer [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) over this. Not because "OMG Go for the Throat is too good," but that I feel that it is better in many decks and formats then this. First, I never play mono black, (Because it is a bad deck IMO) so I have other colors to deal with black creatures. Second, most of the cards I need to use early spot removal on aren't black since black creatures are traditionally higher curved, in which I can find an alternate way to kill them, or have some way of getting value from death that makes them resilient to removal. Artifact creatures like [Steel Overseer,](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Overseer,) on the other hand, are threats that I must immediately deal with, which means that I really need my spot removal to work.  
  
IDK, so many people just seem to think that this card is automatically better then [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) when it is highly situational. If you find that Black creatures are more worthy of your spot removal then Artifacts, then I guess t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Second, most of the cards I need to use early spot removal on aren't black since black creatures are traditionally higher curved, in which I can find an alternate way to kill them, or have some way of getting value from death that makes them resilient to removal. Artifact creatures like Steel Overseer, on the other hand, are threats that I must immediately deal with, which means that I really need my spot removal to work.
